values.prompt: Summarize this email in max 100 words. Focus on: 1) Main request/question 2) Required action 3) Urgency level 4) Key details needed for response

options.systemMessage:
You are a professional email assistant. Create helpful, accurate responses that:
1. Address all key points from the email
2. Maintain professional but friendly tone
3. Keep responses under 150 words
4. Include clear next steps when appropriate
5. Ask clarifying questions if needed
6. Only provide the email body, not subject

You are an expert email editor. Revise emails based on human feedback while:
1. Maintaining professional tone
2. Addressing all feedback points
3. Keeping the core message intact
4. Ensuring clarity and conciseness
5. Only providing the email body content

json.textHtml:
Our new AI gateway hits early access soon. Our gateway gets flexy to your networks and workloads. We're pushing innocent AI agents to their limits with Vijil.
View in browser

Hi, rashadwest!

This month, we have new gateway shapes, cheatsheets, and a single endpoint for all your LLM traffic. All part of my sweeping plan to make you think, "Neato. I didn't know ngrok could do that, too."

 

Early access to ngrok's AI gateway drops next month

 

We're building a single endpoint for all your LLM traffic, local or cloud, so you don't have to kludge together your own. In early access, it'll support:

  • Routing to local and third-party frontier models
  • Load balancing across providers/keys based on input, cost, and usage
  • Find and replace across inputs/outputs
  • Usage tracking and pricing across models
  • ... and more

Niji, our PM for all things AI, is going to start hand-picking folks to start building on it at the end of October. He's looking for people who love AI and build with it all the time, so if that's you (or a friend), make sure you sign up before October 15 to not miss out on the first wave.

 

Get a spot on the waitlist â

 

Don't want to wait on a maybe? Attend one of our in-person events to put yourself at the top of the list:

  • October 14: localhost SFO in-person meetup at our office â
  • October 15: Office Hours #014 livestreamed on YouTube â

    We're raising up other gateway shapes, too

     

    API gateways used to be front doors between the big scary internet and your internal network. But now you're deploying services everywhere, linking disparate networks, and building with LLMs at your side.

     

    You need something with a bit more flexibility, which is why I wrote about some new gateway shapes you can build with ngrok today.

     

    Check out 8 modern shapes â

     

    Ready to jump in? I whipped up a few gateway quickstarts with ngrok primitives:

    • Agent-assisted development (connect localhost to AI tools without leaving the door wide open)
    • localhost for teams (manage many developer environments... once)
    • Self-hosted PaaS alternative (get a Vercel-like experience + WAF + DDoS protection on a stack you own)
    • Microservices (for front door to n+1 clusters)
    • Webhooks in prod (verify webhooks once, not in every service)
    • Databases (when you want something more flexible than that crusty 'ol SSH tunnel)

    I built an AI agent... but can I trust it?


    I built an AI agent to transform Git diffs and commit messages into "user value focused" product- and marketing-speak. Before letting it act on my behalf, I put it through a battery of tests on its security, reliability, and safety with Vijil's special dataset of noisy prompts.

     

    See how my agent held up â

     

    For when you need a tl;dr of the ngrok docs

     

    Your just-in-time reference for building with ngrok and using the CLI is now fully updated thanks to Aaishika, our community manager. It's nearly overflowing with new info on Traffic Policy, internal endpoints, and managing traffic with all our new stuff.

    • Check out the full cheatsheet â
    • Download the two-pager PDF â

    What else is new?

    • A new GitHub project was born to set up a GPU-accelerated server on Kaggle to make an Ollama instance and its models available remotely through ngrok. Get notebooking!
    • Support engineer Sachin published a new video on locking down your apps with OAuth to specific people by their emails or domains.
    • Office Hours #013 dropped with product updates, a hands-on demo of using Traffic Policy to protect your apps in <10 LOC, and a quick dip into Endpoint Pools.

    I'll be back next month with even more gateway shapes and workloads plus a bunch of tips on how to not use ngrok at all (you heard that right) from our new developer educator, Sam Rose. Yes, that Sam Rose.

     

    Joel at ngrok

    Your trust in us matters. Learn more about security at ngrok.

    ngrok Inc., 548 Market St, PMB 26741, San Francisco, California 94104-5401, United States

    Unsubscribe Manage preferences

## I built an AI agent... but can I trust it?

json.textHtml:
Hi Rashad West,

This is a friendly reminder that your Adobe User Research with Esme Xu is at 02:30pm (Eastern Time - US & Canada) on Thursday, September 25, 2025.

Location:

This is a Microsoft Teams web conference.

You can join this meeting from your computer, tablet, or smartphone.
https://calendly.com/events/2c529ad9-5a43-4e5a-b89e-e9850798cb82/microsoft_teams

This will be an 1-1 interview session with a researcher about your experience using After Effects. Prior to the session, please make sure to do the following:


  1. Be in a well-lit location with good internet;
  2. Join the virtual meeting from a computer;
  3. Sign the User Study Consent Form.


Look forward to meeting you!

-Esme

json.textHtml:
On Thursday, October 2 at 11 AM ET, join EU Policy Expert Danny Van Roijen and AI Strategy Lead Caryn Lusinchi
                                                           

 

The EU Data Act: How Will It Affect Your Business?

On Thursday, October 2 at 11 AM ET, join EU Policy Expert Danny Van Roijen and AI Strategy Lead Caryn Lusinchi (Nemko Digital) as they unpack the EU Data Act.

Whether you're leading AI transformation or managing cross-border data flows, this session will help you understand what's comingâand what to do next.
 
 
RSVP for the EU Data Act Session
 
 
  • What the EU Data Act coversâand who it impacts
  • How it connects to GDPR and the EU AI Act
  • What you can do now to prepare, stay compliant, and avoid costly missteps
 
 
Save Your Spot
 

DataCamp, Inc. | 1 Pennsylvania Plaza | Suite 2014 | New York, NY 10119

Unsubscribe

Privacy Policy

The EU Data Act: How Will It Affect Your Business?

On Thursday, October 2 at 11 AM ET, join EU Policy Expert Danny Van Roijen and AI Strategy Lead Caryn Lusinchi (Nemko Digital) as they unpack the EU Data Act.

Whether you're leading AI transformation or managing cross-border data flows, this session will help you understand what's comingâand what to do next.
- What the EU Data Act coversâand who it impacts
	- How it connects to GDPR and the EU AI Act
	- What you can do now to prepare, stay compliant, and avoid costly missteps
DataCamp, Inc. | 1 Pennsylvania Plaza | Suite 2014 | New York, NY 10119

json.textHtml:
Big wins don’t require big teams — just the right tools

Slack helps small teams achieve big things
Download now

Small businesses run on grit, passion, and momentum, but scaling that energy requires the right tools. That’s why they rely on Slack.

Slack is where work happens — powering how businesses grow, innovate, and define their culture. It’s where teams streamline processes, reduce busywork, and move faster together.

Small companies across industries use Slack to:

  • Save 2 hours per day per employee
  • Increase efficiency by 25%
  • Boost upsell win rates by 20%
  • Onboard new customers 2x faster

Download now

json.textHtml:
Our new AI gateway hits early access soon. Our gateway gets flexy to your networks and workloads. We're pushing innocent AI agents to their limits with Vijil.
View in browser

Hi, rashadwest!

This month, we have new gateway shapes, cheatsheets, and a single endpoint for all your LLM traffic. All part of my sweeping plan to make you think, "Neato. I didn't know ngrok could do that, too."

 

Early access to ngrok's AI gateway drops next month

 

We're building a single endpoint for all your LLM traffic, local or cloud, so you don't have to kludge together your own. In early access, it'll support:

  • Routing to local and third-party frontier models
  • Load balancing across providers/keys based on input, cost, and usage
  • Find and replace across inputs/outputs
  • Usage tracking and pricing across models
  • ... and more

Niji, our PM for all things AI, is going to start hand-picking folks to start building on it at the end of October. He's looking for people who love AI and build with it all the time, so if that's you (or a friend), make sure you sign up before October 15 to not miss out on the first wave.

 

Get a spot on the waitlist â

 

Don't want to wait on a maybe? Attend one of our in-person events to put yourself at the top of the list:

  • October 14: localhost SFO in-person meetup at our office â
  • October 15: Office Hours #014 livestreamed on YouTube â

    We're raising up other gateway shapes, too

     

    API gateways used to be front doors between the big scary internet and your internal network. But now you're deploying services everywhere, linking disparate networks, and building with LLMs at your side.

     

    You need something with a bit more flexibility, which is why I wrote about some new gateway shapes you can build with ngrok today.

     

    Check out 8 modern shapes â

     

    Ready to jump in? I whipped up a few gateway quickstarts with ngrok primitives:

    • Agent-assisted development (connect localhost to AI tools without leaving the door wide open)
    • localhost for teams (manage many developer environments... once)
    • Self-hosted PaaS alternative (get a Vercel-like experience + WAF + DDoS protection on a stack you own)
    • Microservices (for front door to n+1 clusters)
    • Webhooks in prod (verify webhooks once, not in every service)
    • Databases (when you want something more flexible than that crusty 'ol SSH tunnel)

    I built an AI agent... but can I trust it?


    I built an AI agent to transform Git diffs and commit messages into "user value focused" product- and marketing-speak. Before letting it act on my behalf, I put it through a battery of tests on its security, reliability, and safety with Vijil's special dataset of noisy prompts.

     

    See how my agent held up â

     

    For when you need a tl;dr of the ngrok docs

     

    Your just-in-time reference for building with ngrok and using the CLI is now fully updated thanks to Aaishika, our community manager. It's nearly overflowing with new info on Traffic Policy, internal endpoints, and managing traffic with all our new stuff.

    • Check out the full cheatsheet â
    • Download the two-pager PDF â

    What else is new?

    • A new GitHub project was born to set up a GPU-accelerated server on Kaggle to make an Ollama instance and its models available remotely through ngrok. Get notebooking!
    • Support engineer Sachin published a new video on locking down your apps with OAuth to specific people by their emails or domains.
    • Office Hours #013 dropped with product updates, a hands-on demo of using Traffic Policy to protect your apps in <10 LOC, and a quick dip into Endpoint Pools.

    I'll be back next month with even more gateway shapes and workloads plus a bunch of tips on how to not use ngrok at all (you heard that right) from our new developer educator, Sam Rose. Yes, that Sam Rose.

     

    Joel at ngrok

    Your trust in us matters. Learn more about security at ngrok.

    ngrok Inc., 548 Market St, PMB 26741, San Francisco, California 94104-5401, United States

    Unsubscribe Manage preferences

Your just-in-time reference for building with ngrok and using the CLI is now fully updated thanks to Aaishika, our community manager. It's nearly overflowing with new info on Traffic Policy, internal endpoints, and managing traffic with all our new stuff.

json.subject: [ngrok news] New AI gateway early access, new shape of gateway things

This month, we have new gateway shapes, cheatsheets, and a single endpoint for all your LLM traffic. All part of my sweeping plan to make you think, "Neato. I didn't know ngrok could do that, too." Early access to ngrok's AI gateway drops next month We're building a single endpoint for all your LLM traffic, local or cloud, so you don't have to kludge together your own. In early access, it'll support: Routing to local and third-party frontier models Load balancing across providers/keys based on input, cost, and usage Find and replace across inputs/outputs Usage tracking and pricing across models ... and more Niji, our PM for all things AI, is going to start hand-picking folks to start building on it at the end of October. He's looking for people who love AI and build with it all the time, so if that's you (or a friend), make sure you sign up before October 15 to not miss out on the first wave. Hi Rashad West,

This is a friendly reminder that your Adobe User Research with Esme Xu is at 02:30pm (Eastern Time - US & Canada) on Thursday, September 25, 2025.

Location:

This is a Microsoft Teams web conference.

You can join this meeting from your computer, tablet, or smartphone.
https://calendly.com/events/2c529ad9-5a43-4e5a-b89e-e9850798cb82/microsoft_teams

This will be an 1-1 interview session with a researcher about your experience using After Effects. Prior to the session, please make sure to do the following:


  1. Be in a well-lit location with good internet;
  2. Join the virtual meeting from a computer;
  3. Sign the User Study Consent Form.


Look forward to meeting you!

-Esme
